title: Gravinate 120ML Liquid

precautions: Before taking any medications, several precautions must be taken to avoid any mishaps or health hazards. Medications taken carelessly often do more harm than good. Gravinate syrup must not be consumed on an empty stomach, or with alcohol. It should not come by men who suffer from an enlarged prostate gland. Otherwise, it may cause pain while urinating. Individuals with increased eye pressure, the cardiac disease should inform their physician for appropriate prescription or dosage.The use of medicine should be avoided before or during driving as it can cause sedation. In the case of the underlying disease, the physician should be consulted first. For gravinate dose in pregnancy, consult your doctor.

precautions: Do not take Motilium if you are allergic to domperidone or any other ingredients of this syrup discussed in the start of the description. If they have any blood circulation problem of the heart, or if they have irregular heart-beat should not take this medicine.
effects: There are some side effects that are very rare, and some side effects are common. The un-common side effects of Motilium syrup are very rare it happens 1 person in 100. The uncommon side effects include anxiety, agitation, nervousness, headache, diarrhoea and rash. All these side effects that are discussed are not likely to happen to everyone who takes this medication. The benefit of this drug is much more than its side effects.

title: Onset 8MG Inj 1x1 (P)
details:
Onset injection belongs to the category of medicine known as antiemetic. This medication is primarily used to control the feelings of nausea and vomiting. The main or active ingredient in this medication is ondansetron. 

Uses

precautions: Inform the doctor about your medical history before using the medication.Read the leaflet to ensure the ingredients list. Do not use the product if you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in the medication. It is considered safe to be used by pregnant women, but breastfeeding females are advised not to take the injection because it can pass into the baby in small amounts through breast milk. Patients undergoing chemotherapy and any other kind of surgery usually get feelings of nausea and vomiting. Doctors usually prescribe the injection to such patients in order to make them feel better and relaxed.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Irregular heartbeat, Liver disease, Recent abdominal surgery, Ileus, Swelling. Side effects may include digestive problems, i.e. vomiting, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal cramps, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), heartburn, feeling of sickness, etc. Others are loss of appetite, drowsiness, headache, skin allergies, swelling, vision disorders, etc. Consult a doctor or seek a healthcare provider in case of any adverse reaction.

title: Dysit 8MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: It helps to treat vomiting and nausea in patients who are getting chemotherapy (cancer patients) or radiotherapy treatment.
precautions: Avoid this drug if you're hypersensitive to ondansetron or any other serotonin inhibitor medicine. Keep all medicines out of the reach of children, or small kids. Store at a dark, dry, and cool place. Protect from sunlight. Do not use if the packing (of tablets) is damaged or broken.
effects: Side effects of using ondansetron are abdominal pain, dizziness, headache, chest pain, blurred vision, and increased heart rate, etc.

title: Onset 8MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details:
Onset is an 8 mg tablet that is available for the treatment of nausea and vomiting that is mainly caused by after-effects of chemotherapy and radiation therapy caused by cancer.

Onset tablet is the antiemetic agent that contains that has th

READ MORE
precautions: It is highly suggested to share your complete medical history with your doctor before consuming the set medication. This may contain some inactive ingredients that can trigger allergic reactions in people prone to allergies.It is advised not to use onset tablet if you are allergic to drugs includingmononitrate and nitroglycerin. Always tell your doctor before consuming this medication.If you have gone through any head injury or surgery, consult your doctor. Moreover, if you have experienced fainting, irregular heartbeat and troubles breathing after onset intake, immediately consult your doctor.It is highly advised not to use onset tablet, especially if you have anemia, blood pressure, dehydration or any heart disease, to avoid developing side effects.  This onset medications likely to cause dizziness; thus, it is advised not to drive while you are on a dose.Women must not use onset tablet during pregnancy and while breastfeeding as it is likely to cause allergies to babies due to active ingredients it has within.
effects: There are some side effects associated with onset tablet intake, which are as follows:HeadachedizzinessnauseaSkin problems (itching, redness, swelling)Irregular heartbeatTell your doctor before they become fatal and deadly if any of these symptoms last longer. Initially, side effects are mild, but they can become chronic if not treated on time.

title: Motilium V Tab 5x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat Vomiting, Delayed gastric emptying, Functional dyspepsia, GERD, Heart burn.
precautions: Contraindicated in Allergy, Hepatic impairment, GI mycoses. Should be taken with caution in Cardiac arrhythmias or Hypokalaemia.
effects: Thirst, Headache, Drowsiness, Diarrhea, Anxiety, Insomnia, Skin rashes, Dry mouth, Breat enlargement, Soreness, Reduced libido.

title: Ondanz 8MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: This medication is used to prevent Nausea and Vomiting caused by Chemotherapy and Radiation therapy.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Irregular heartbeat, Liver disease, Recent abdominal surgery, Ileus, Swelling. This medication should be used only when clearly needed during pregnancy.
effects: Headache, Lightheadedness, Dizziness, Drowsiness, Tiredness, or Constipation may occur.

title: Ondaset IM/IV 4MG/2ML Inj 1x5 (L)
details: It is used for the treatment of nausea and vomiting in patients that have taken chemotherapy or radiotherapy.
precautions: Keep out of the reach of children. Store at room temperature, i.e. below 30 degrees Celsius. Protect from heat, humidity, or direct exposure to sunlight. Avoid it if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients.
effects: It rarely causes any kinds of adverse reactions. Side effects may include digestive problems, i.e. vomiting, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal cramps, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), heartburn, feeling of sickness, etc. Others are loss of appetite, drowsiness, headache, skin allergies, swelling, vision disorders, etc. Consult a doctor or seek a healthcare provider in case of any adverse reaction.

title: Metoclon 10MG Inj 1x10 (L)
details: It is used as a short-term treatment (4 to 12 weeks) for ongoing heartburn when the usual medicines do not work well enough. It is used mostly for heartburn that occurs after a meal or during the daytime.
precautions: Consult a doctor, if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.
effects: Drowsiness, Dizziness, Tiredness, Trouble sleeping, Agitation, Headache, and Diarrhea may occur.
